data.description: Job Posting Title:Walt Disney World Transportation Logistics & Analytics Intern, Summer/Fall 2026Req ID:10140614Job Description:About the Role & ProgramAs a member of the Transportation Logistics & Analytics team, the Intern is responsible for gathering and analyzing a variety of data, visualizing the data into a cohesive and compelling story, and then delivering that story to key partners to influence strategic decisions and drive the business forward.Candidates should be curious, think proactively, be eager to solve complex problems, and have a strong instinct to act. Experience in influencing and partnering with others is an important attribute as is the ability to balance multiple priorities and manage time appropriately. The Transportation Logistics & Analytics team is a fun, energetic, and close-knit team that is proud of the vital role they play and wants to share that passion with others!This internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in the Orlando, FL area from June 2026-January 2027.What You Will DoAnalyze diverse datasets using multiple tools and forecasting models, while maintaining and enhancing existing tools and creating new models as neededBuild efficient SQL queries and Snowflake tables to support scalable analyticsCreate visualizations using Tableau that effectively and succinctly summarize analysis and recommendations to tell the necessary storyPresent updates and recommendations to key partners, including executivesPartner with multiple teams, including Transportation Engineering Services, Industrial Engineering, Finance and Workforce ManagementRequired Qualifications & SkillsPositive approach with a focus on how to accomplish the tasks at handDemonstrated ability to streamline data pipelines and support the automation of data process for efficiency and maintainabilitySuperb written and oral communication skills, as well as experience developing presentationsProven strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skillsAbility to balance multiple demands and competing priorities in a complex business environmentWorks well in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlinesResourceful and proactive, with an ability to leverage existing partnerships or forge new relationships to navigate complex situationsPreferred QualificationsProven experience with Python programming languagesExperience with cloud-based storage software like SnowflakeKnowledge of SAS or SQL programmingExperience with Tableau or PowerBI visualization techniquesEducationJunior or Senior year preferredMajor or previous coursework in Logistics, Supply Chain Logistics, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or related major preferredEligibility Requirements & Program InformationCandidates for this opportunity MUST meet all of the below requirements: Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.Be at least 18 years of agePossess unrestricted work authorization.Additional InformationThis internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in the Orlando, FL area from June 2026-January 2027.Able to have a consistent, reliable work schedule throughout the internshipFully available Monday through Friday for the duration of the internship, 40 hours each week.Able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship program in the Orlando, FL area.Able to provide/have own reliable transportation to/from work.Be compliant with The Disney Look appearance guidelines.Limited housing opportunities may be available for Florida Based Professional Interns through American Campus Communities, for more information click here.Recommendation â€“ Print This Role Description: We encourage applicants to print a copy of this role description so they can refer to it in the event they are selected for an interview. Note that this role description will not be accessible once the posting is closed.The pay rate for this role in Florida is $31.00 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.Job Posting Segment:Other OpsJob Posting Primary Business:Transportation (WDW)Primary Job Posting Category:Data Science and Analytics Intern, OtherEmployment Type:Full timePrimary City, State, Region, Postal Code:Lake Buena Vista, FL, USAAlternate City, State, Region, Postal Code:Date Posted:2026-01-19
requirements: Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.
Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.
Be at least 18 years of age
responsibilities: Superb written and oral communication skills, as well as experience developing presentations
